contactInfo.postalAddress: Worldpay, The Walbrook Building, 25 Walbrook, London, EC4N 8AF
Data Protection Officer, Worldpay, The Walbrook Building, 25 Walbrook, London, EC4N 8AF

general.observations: Worldpay's policy contains a section on data rights under GDPR and outlines the rights available to data subjects but does not offer any instructions on how to exercise such rights. A later paragraph indicates that these rights can be exercised by contacting the DPO.

list: Service providers and other third parties who help with the business operations of Worldpay
Social media sites integrated into Worldpay web services
Analytics and search engine providers (ordinarily non-personal info)
Third party credit and financial institutions
thirdParties.observations: Worldpay publish a table as an appendix to the privacy notice, which contains a more detailed breakdown of specifically what information will be available to which of the third parties that are mentioned in the notice.

retentionRules.summary:
Worldpay only retains personal information for as long as is required to achieve the purposes for which it was collected.

The policy notes that specific retention periods vary based on regulatory requirements but suggests that most data will not be retained for more than 7 years.

lawfulBases.legalObligation: The policy indicates that they process data for "legal, regulatory or law enforcement purposes"
lawfulBases.legitimateInterests: Worldpay appear to rely on legitimate interests for all other data processing.
lawfulBases.observations: Worldpay do not clearly break down the lawful bases under which they process data. It appears that they rely on legal obligations as the lawful basis for processing data for "legal, regulatory or law enforcement purposes", and legitimate interests for everything else.

securityStandards.observations: The policy contains some basic information about how Worldpay secure personal customer information though it is not particularly specific.

complaintInformation.observations: The policy includes information about submitting a complaint to the ICO about Worldpay's data processing.
complaintInformation.sourceText:
If you have any queries or complaints about the processing of your Personal Information in the United Kingdom, you can also contact the ICO here.

If you have any queries or complaints about the processing of your Personal Information in the United States, you can also contact the FTC here.
